Metadata: The biocatalytic transformation of furan to amide in the bioactive marine natural product palinurin

Furanosesterpen​es, which display a range of bioactivity, are frequently isolated from marine sponges. Palinurin, a linear furanosesterter​pene, was isolated in gram quantities from a Red Sea sponge "Ircinia echinata". In this paper, researchers describe two novel microbial metabolites of palinurin, palinurine A and B, produced by the fungus "Cunninghamella​" sp. NRRL 5695. This reaction may be of significant value in the field of synthetic organic chemistry. The possible transformation of furans to amides through a biomimetic reaction is certain to have applications in synthetic chemistry.
